result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mario Ivan Perez Barrios

records.addlTxt:
1:44 PM Defendant Mario Ivan Perez Barrios in court and by video.  Attorney Matt Lantta in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Robert C Howard Iii appeared by video. Laura Salcido Sworn on oath as interpreter. Attorney Howard has received an offer, but has not had time to talk to his client about it. Attorney Howard requests matter be set out 45 days for plea and sentencing. Attorney Lantta requests matter be set for preliminary hearing or a waiver needs to be filed. Attorney Howard not prepared for that today. The Court requests matter be scheduled 30 days out. If no plea at that time trial dates will be set. The Court asks Attorney Howard to communicate the offer with his client. Bond Continues. Matter set over.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:45 PM Defendant Mario Ivan Perez Barrios appeared by phone.  Attorney Matt Lantta in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Robert C Howard Iii appeared by video. Interpreter Sally Nichols appeared via zoom. Interpreter Sally Nichols sworn in under oath. Atty Howard states there is no resolution yet. Atty Howard requests status to be set in a couple weeks. Attorney Howard gives the DE his phone number. DE phone number (608)713-2341. Matter set over to allow the DE and his attorney to communicate an offer. The State Withdraws their request for the bail bond forfeiture. 
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing on October 18, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

2:05 PM Defendant Mario Ivan Perez Barrios in court.  Attorney Matt Lantta in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jane Krueger- Smith appeared in court for Attorney Howard. Saul Artega Sworn on oath as interpreter. Attorney Krueger Smith requests matters to be set over to previously scheduled date. No objection from the State. Warrant is vacated. Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing. Matters set for 10-04-2022 at 2:45 PM.
Clerk emailed WCCC to Monroe PD

2:38 PM Defendant Mario Ivan Perez Barrios not in court.  Attorney Laura Kohl in court for State of Wisconsin appearing specially for Attorney Matt Lantta.  Attorney Robert C Howard Iii in court for the defendant.  Based on the defendants non appearance the State requests a warrant to issue if one isn't already issued. The Court orders warrant to issue. Body only, continental United States. The State requests bail to be forfeited. Matter set over.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing on October 4, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Status conference on September 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Arrest-Bench Warrant  GF-142_1 - Perez Barrios, Mario Ivan

Body Only
State of WI only

1:58 PM Defendant Mario Ivan Perez Barrios not in court.  Attorney Robert C Howard Iii appeared by video.  Attorney Matt Lantta in court for State of Wisconsin. Based on the defendants non appearance the State requests a bench warrant to issue. The Court orders a bench warrant to issue. Body Only, State of Wisconsin.
22R 004726  Posted by:  Silverio Perez    2203 - 12th Ave.  Monroe, Wi  53566

Issuing Agency: MPD
Violations: 2 counts - Bail jumping. 2 counts - criminal damage to property. Battery. DC. 2 counts - resist/obstruct officer.
Conditions: May not possess or consume any intoxicants. No violent or abusive or disorderly contact with: A.G.P.C. / V.P.C / V.C. / H.E.A. Defendant shall immediately complete processing at the Monroe Police Department once he is released.

1:18 PM Defendant Mario Ivan Perez Barrios appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matt Lantta appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Adam Witt appears on behalf of the defendant for bond purposes only. Interpreter Sally Nichols sworn in under oath to interpret.Court advises defendant of rights.  Court advises defendant of charges and penalties. Defendant given complaint.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
